item.title: Ticket #3033 (Identical Permalinks for Different Attachments) created
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
If you upload 2 different attachments in one post, give them the same title, and send them to the editor "linked to page," then both will end up with the same permalink for their "pages."

It happens because wp_insert_attachment() doesn't check to see if the post_name already exists.

My patch increments the post_name similarly to the way in which a regular post's post_name increments when it has a duplicate.

item.title: Ticket #2828 (Ease MySQL4.1 character set configuration) updated
item.dc:creator: janX
item.description:
Works for me.

This still doesn't fix the issues with pre-composed and composed Unicode characters I am experiencing. Does anyone know how to get MySQL to match Ü (U+00DC) with Ü (U+0055 U+0308)?

item.title: Ticket #3032 (Snow number of comments for each member in Authors & Users tab in ...) created
item.dc:creator: war59312
item.description:
Perhaps the number of comments for each member could be added to the Authors & Users tab in wordpress admin control panel.

It is very easy to do so. Just need to add the row to wp-admin/users.php .

item.title: Ticket #3030 (create a function to retrieve the categories a post is assigned to) reopened
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond

item.title: Ticket #3026 (New login page looks ugly with registration enabled) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond

item.title: Ticket #3031 (Add link location to Browse area) created
item.dc:creator: podz
item.description: When a user uploads an image they have no idea where that image is. For a post image, not a problem. For an image they may want to use in a sidebar or for linking but not displaying their only way to find out is to publish and View Source or to right-click and check the properties. Both are poor. We should have some way to allow a non-savy user to see and obtain an object location.

item.title: Ticket #3015 (wp_list_cats doesn't hide category with only a future post) updated
item.dc:creator: murky

item.title: Ticket #3030 (create a function to retrieve the categories a post is assigned to) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Sounds pretty niche. And it could be done via a plugin by running a filter on the_category to remove the links.

item.title: Ticket #3030 (create a function to retrieve the categories a post is assigned to) created
item.dc:creator: anks329
item.description: Right now, the function the_category retrieves a list of categories along with links. There should be a function that does the same thing, except only returns a list of the categories and not links. This would be useful for targeting ads based on the category of the post.
